title: Product Documentation / Shortcuts / Info

BE ADVISED, ANY SECTIONS / CASES THAT BEGIN WITH ** MAY INDICATE EITHER:

> Premature implementation (Functionality not there yet / Unable to test) 
> Indication of updates needed (Test with caution / Question before failing)
> Consideration for omission (Due to change in functional specifications)
_________________________________________________

[ FREE PASS ]

NOTE: ADD/REMOVE/EDIT LINKS AS THEY BECOME AVAILABLE OR INVALID

title: Install Patch over Base, Logged in
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- User is logged in to an MLB.tv Premium Entitled Account in base build.
custom_steps:
1. Install current MLB.tv build
2. Launch installed build
3. Navigate to Menu>Settings
custom_expected: Next to "Logged in as" field app shows same MLB.tv Premium Entitled Account as the account user was logged in to in base build.

title: Install Patch over Base, Logged out - Successful Log In
custom_preconds:
- Base build is installed 
- User is not logged in to an MLB.tv Account in base build.
custom_steps:
1. Install current MLB.tv build
2. Launch installed build
3. Navigate to Menu>Settings
4. Activate Log in button
5. Log in to MLB.tv Account
custom_expected: App successfully allows login, next to "Logged in as" field app shows MLB.tv Account ID.

title: App Icon (Graphics)
custom_preconds: Given MLB.TV is installed on the PS Vita
custom_steps: When viewing app icons on PS Vita home screen
custom_expected: Then the app graphics and name of the app display without issue.

title: PlayStation Network Sign in
custom_preconds: Given MLB.TV is installed on the PS Vita and user has not signed in to PS Network.
custom_steps: When app is launched from Vita home screen
custom_expected: Then PlayStation Network Sign In prompt displays. User must sign in with a valid PS Network account before the app launch.

title: Launching MLB.TV app via PS Vita home screen
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed

and the user has signed into PlayStation Network account

and the app is not running
custom_steps: When the user taps theMLB.Tv app icon
custom_expected:
The user is brought to the Start screen

and the app logo displays on the start button displays without issue

and the background page displays players on the diamond

title: Loading Animation
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed

And the User has logged in to PlayStation Network

And is on the Start screen
custom_steps: When user taps the START button
custom_expected: Then the MLB.TV logo and loading animation display; bases in the diamond fill as the app loads.

title: User Not Logged In - Appearance and Recap Access
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Game Tile
2. Activate any game feed
3. Observe messaging
4. Activate RECAP button
custom_expected:
User sees expected messaging:
_You can only view the recap. Login with a valid MLB.com account to view more_
_To purchase a subscription, go to http://MLB.com/ps3 *_

Feed selected launches and playback begins

*Messaging listed here must be confirmed correct and current before giving a Pass - also per platform the messaging should match - ps3 vs. ps4 or ps vita

title: Login to Free Account via Game Tile
custom_preconds: App has been launched with live or VOD Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Premium (non-free) Game Tile
2. Observe Login Required Message
3. Press 'O' then 'â–³' and access the Setting menu
4. Login with Free Account
5. Go back and Activate Premium Feed
6. Note Premium Account required Message Shown
7. Close message
8. Nav to Free Game of Day Tile and activate
9. Activate any feed
custom_expected: In step 6, Premium Account Required is shown - in step 9 Feed selected launches and playback begins (pre-roll followed by game feed)

title: Dismiss Login Required
custom_preconds: App has been launched with Live Game Tiles displayed, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate any Live Game Tile
2. At Login Required Message, Activate [CIRCLE] (Log in later)
custom_expected: Message closes to Day View

title: Unrecognized Login - expected messaging
custom_preconds: User is not logged in, app is on Settings page.
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log in button on Settings page.
2. Enter any text (not a valid email account!) into EMAIL and PASSWORD fields.
3. Activate [SQUARE] (Sign In)
4. Observe Messaging, activate [CIRCLE] (Try Again)
custom_expected: App shows error text "The account name or password was incorrect. Please verify login credentials and try again." at Sign In and returns to Login screen at Try Again.

title: Logout Confirmation and Logout
custom_preconds: User is logged in to any MLB.com registered account and is on Settings page
custom_steps:
1. Activate Log Out button. Log Out Confirmation Screen opens.
2. At Log Out Confirmation Screen, activate [CIRCLE] BACK
3. Activate Log Out button. Log Out Confirmation Screen opens.
4. At Log Out Confirmation Screen, activate [X] LOGOUT
custom_expected:
Confirm Log Out Confirmation screen can be closed and that Logout returns user to Settings.
Settings Log Out button should be replaced with Log In and user ID should no longer appear beneath it.

title: Login via Settings - Launch Game
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. Login with Premium Account
3. Dismiss Account Activated message via [X] (OK)
4. Close Settings with [CIRCLE] (Back)
5. Nav to VOD game tile and activate.
6. Launch any feed.
custom_expected: Feed selected launches and playback begins

title: Login via Settings - Access Menu
custom_preconds: App is on Settings page, user is not logged in.
custom_steps:
1. Select and activate Log in
2. Login with Premium Account
3. Jump to Menu from Account Activated message via [TRIANGLE]
4. Confirm Menu appearance and dismiss via [CIRCLE] (Close)
custom_expected:
App opens Main Menu, Close returns to Settings with user's logged-in ID seen under Log out button.


this test is failing until the ticket below is fixed:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/DEVICES-2700

title: Too Many Usage Attempts
custom_preconds: User is not logged in and app is at login page (via Settings or Game tile).
custom_steps:
1. At login page enter email "mlbtv+sso@gmail.com" with the password "Password1"
2. Activate VOD Game Tile 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected:
Error Message shown: "Your account is currently in use at another location.  Reset your password by logging in to MLB.com, click on 'My Profile' and change your password."


*** Ongoing issue exists which will cause a FAIL here: 

https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/DEVICES-2601
SONY PS/PS VITA > Too Many Usage Attempts Account blocks login, should block playback of Premium Video

title: Password Changed - Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has not been launched.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. Launch app.
custom_expected:
Confirm user is logged out at launch. 

***Improvement planned for useful messaging to appear here.

title: Password Changed during App use - VOD Launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has been launched and user is sitting on any Day view page with VOD games that require a premium account.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. In app, launch any premium VOD video stream.
custom_expected: Confirm user cannot launch video, receives expected configured message and is logged out.

title: Password Changed during App use - LIVE launch
custom_preconds:
App is linked (logged in during previous session) to an MLB.com premium entitled account and user has access to it's MLB.com account settings.
App has been launched and user is sitting on any Day view page with games that require a premium account.
custom_steps:
1. Go to account's MLB.com settings page and change the password.
2. In app, launch any premium Live video stream.
custom_expected: Confirm user cannot launch video, receives expected configured message and is logged out.

title: Login: Non-Latin Characters
custom_preconds: User's PS device set to Japanese, app launched, user not logged in to app
custom_steps:
1. Go to Settings
2. Activate Log In
3. In Email & Password fields enter Japanese characters
4. Activate Square (Sign In)
custom_expected: Email field does not display Japanese characters and app does not freeze at Sign In button activation

title: Executive Accounts Behavior
custom_preconds:
User has access to Exec Test Account 
Live National, Regional and Locally blacked out games are available (or set up in QA with Audio included)
Live games NOT blacked out available
custom_steps:
1. Log in to Exec account via Settings
2. Nav to each type of live game in Day View and launch all feeds in Feed Select, A/V
- National
- Regional Blacked Out
- Regional not blacked out
- Locally blacked out
- Non-blacked out
- MLB PLUS
- FGotD
3. Nav to any Day View Archive game's Feed Select and launch Archive and Recap
4. Nav to Home team page
5. Launch a Highlight
6. Launch all of the game types listed above in step 2 from Home Team view
custom_expected: User can log in, all feeds are accessible & launch without issue - black out is bypassed

title: Single Team Accounts
custom_preconds: User has single team account paired with Live Games options: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/CDANDMSFT/2016+Single+Team+Test+Accounts
custom_steps:
1. Log in to single team account which has a live game playing
2. Attempt to launch all Audio feeds (if available)
3. Attempt to launch opponent feed (if available)
4. Attempt to launch preferred single team feed
5. Repeat steps 3 & 4 with an Archive game
custom_expected: Only user's preferred single team audio or video feeds launch, all other feeds show an upsell/premium account required message

title: Free Accounts
custom_preconds:
User has access to free account and is logged in
( Create at https://securea.mlb.com/enterworkflow.do?flowId=registration.connect.wizard&c_id=mlb&template=mobile&forwardUrl=http://mlb.mlb.com/home )
App is launched to Today view
Free and Premium Live games available
custom_steps:
1. Launch Premium Live game
2. Launch free Live game
3. Launch Premium Archive game 
4. Launch free Archive game
5. Launch Recap
6. Repeat above from Home Team view
7. Launch Highlight
custom_expected:
Premium games show upsell/Premium Account required message
Free games, highlights and a recap launch to playback (Pre-roll testing handled elsewhere)

title: Home/Today Navigation
custom_preconds: App is on any day's Day Grid view, 1st tile in top left is selected.
custom_steps:
1. From 1st position, top left Game Tile, navigate to far right tile.
2. From top right, nav [R] 
3. Continue to navigate [R] to select each tile in the grid until the last tile is reached in the bottom row, farthest let.
4. From last tile nav [L] back to 1st position, top left Game Tile
custom_expected: Selecting each tile shows expected highlight. Game tile grid nav does not loop top to bottom or vice-versa. [U] ARROW along top & [D] ARROW along bottom disabled if no additional rows are available, [L] along left selects 1st tile in next row down - disabled if no row available, [R] along right edge select last tile in next row up - disabled if no row available.

title: Today's date - Transition from 8am to TODAY
custom_preconds:
THIS TEST MUST BE PERFORMED IN AROUND BUT BEFORE 8 AM PT (11AM ET)
User's profile has a team set as a favorite that played a game the previous day.
custom_steps:
1. Launch application (Should default to today's Day View)
2. Confirm Today's date in top right corner shows yesterday's date
3. While app is at a time preceding 8am PT (11am ET) observe Day View, confirm favorited team VOD from previous day plays in the video tile.
4. Before time reaches 8am PT (11am ET), tap [SQUARE] TODAY button.
5. Remaining on Day view, allow app to transition past 8:05am PT (11:05am ET)
6. Tap [SQUARE] TODAY button.
custom_expected:
In step 4 app does not jump from current page.
In step 6 app transitions to TODAY view for actual current date.

title: Today's date - Transition past 4pm PT (Midnight GMT)
custom_preconds: THIS TEST MUST BE PERFORMED IN AROUND BUT BEFORE 4PM PST (7PM EST)
custom_steps:
1. Launch application (Should default to today's Day View)
2. Confirm Today's date in top right corner is correct 
3. While app is at a time preceding 4pm PT (7pm ET) observe Day View.
4. Remaining on Day view, allow app to transition to a minimum of 4:05pm PT
custom_expected: Transition past 12AM GMT does not have any effect on Today view.

title: Day to Day Navigation
custom_preconds: App is in Day View, TODAY.
custom_steps:
1. Note date in top right corner.
2. Activate L1 and note the date in top right corner after transition.
3. Repeat step 2 until 10 days back have been noted.
4. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to TODAY (note date in top right corner)
5. Activate R1 and note the date in top right corner after transition.
6. Repeat step 5 until 10 days forward have been noted.
7. Tap [SQUARE] button & confirm return to TODAY (note date in top right corner)
custom_expected: Today's date in steps 1, 4 and 7 should be seen in top left. Each day back or forward should show the date advance as expected.

title: All-Star Game/Break (Empty Days)
custom_steps:
1. From Main Menu PU activate Calendar
2. Navigate to July
3. Activate July 12th 2016
4. Activate [ R1 ] to nav to July 13th
5. Repeat step 4 until July 15th is reached
6. Activate [ L1 ] to nav to July 14th
7. Repeat step 6 until July 12th is reached
custom_expected:
- Each day tested is accessible 
- July 11, 13 & 14 show "No Games Scheduled" text
- July 12 shows All-Star Game game tile

title: Future Game Tiles: Activation
custom_preconds: User is logged in with a Premium Entitled account and app is launched and on TODAY view
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to future date via R1
2. Select any game tile and activate
custom_expected: Tile is disabled and no Error or other unwanted behavior occurs

title: Navigation
custom_preconds: Main Menu is open.
custom_steps:
1. From Home button, navigate up, right, left and down.
2. Repeat step one for each button.
custom_expected:
Left and right for every button should be disabled.
Up from top and down from bottom should be disabled.
If a button is above the button highlighted, it can be selected.
If a button is below the button highlighted, it can be selected.

is on Today view and Main Menu is open

app has been launched and Main Menu is open

2. Activate [BACK] to close.

Calendar
Standings
Leaderboards
Home Team

title: Home Team - Ensure that 'Home Team' can be changed from 'Home Team' menu

2. Choose any team other than the one that is already selected

The correct team is displayed after selecting a different 'Home Team'.

Note:
Complete this for all 30 MLB Teams.

2. From the 'Home Team' menu, select any highlight
custom_expected: The highlight plays without any issue

custom_steps: 1. From the 'Home Team' view, attempt to launch either a live game or a VOD.
custom_expected: Only highlights should launch when when not logged in with an MLB account.

title: Home Team - 'Game Section' - First Game tile is selected and in hover state
Calendar Grid Navigation
custom_preconds: App is on any Calendar page with the 1st selected.
custom_steps:
1. From the 1st in any month, hold the D-Pad right key down until navigation reaches last day of month confirm D-Pad right is disabled from last day
2. From the last day, hold the D-Pad left key down until navigation reaches 1st day of month and confirm D-Pad left is disabled from 1st day
3. Navigate to all buttons along top row and for each, attempt to navigate up
4. Navigate to all buttons along bottom row and for each, attempt to navigate down
custom_expected:
- All buttons are selectable, up from all buttons along top (no day buttons above) disabled, down from all bottoms along bottom (no day buttons below) disabled.
- When navigating right from right-most tile, if a row exists below, 1st tile in row below is selected. 
- When navigating left from left-most tile, if a row exists above, last tile in row above is selected. 
- D-pad hold results in multiple selections if available.

title: TODAY tag
custom_preconds: If there are no games being played in the current month, this test must be conducted in the QA environment
custom_steps:
1. From Day View, Today, open Main Menu via [TRIANGLE]
2. Activate Calendar
3. Navigate to TODAY tagged day button and activate
custom_expected: TODAY is tagged for today's actual date and activation returns to Today Day View.

custom_preconds:
Before testing, confirm allowed/expected start and end dates

2. Activate [L1] repeatedly to navigate to previous months until reaching earliest available month

custom_steps:

2. Navigate to July
3. Activate July 11th 2016 (empty day)

- July 11, 13 & 14 show "No Games Scheduled" text
- July 12 shows All-Star Game game tile

title: Change Display Team
custom_preconds: App has been launched with ALL TEAMS set for the Calendar view and Calendar is open to current month
custom_steps:
1. Activate [SELECT] for PS3/Vita or [ R3 ] for PS4
2. In SELECT TEAM, choose any team (activate)
3. From Calendar activate [SELECT] for PS3/Vita or [ R3 ] for PS4
4. In SELECT TEAM, choose any different team (activate)
5. Observe and note details of any single day in Calendar
6. Activate observed day
7. Quit app & relaunch
8. Open Main Menu > Calendar
custom_expected:
- Confirm Team Indicator in Top Left corner appears as expected, changing when choosing different teams
- Confirm confirm Calendar data reflects actual Game Day data
- Confirm Chosen Team persists after quit

title: Settings Navigation
custom_preconds: Settings has been opened from Main Menu.
custom_steps:
In Settings, navigate to all buttons and upon completion, activate [CIRCLE] Back

[CIRCLE] Back exits to Day Grid View
custom_expected:
All buttons on screen can be selected/highlighted.

Confirm the following:

- Auto-selected button at start is Show Scores
- D-pad left from all buttons on left side DA
- D-pad right from all buttons on right side DA
- D-pad up from all buttons on top edge DA
- D-pad down from all bottoms bottom edge DA
- L/R from Show Scores <--> Home Team <--> Today can be navigated/selected
- L/R from Show Stadium BGs <--> Home Team Pref can be navigated/selected
- L from Pick Favorites jumps to Show Stadium BGs
- L from Login jumps to Show Stadium BGs

title: Default Settings
custom_preconds: Uninstall any MLB.tv app the device, turn system off, reboot system and install current build (full test build, not patch)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings and observe
custom_expected:
Confirm Default Settings:

- Show Scores ON
- Show Stadium BGs ON
- Home Screen Preference TODAY
- Home Team Preference NOT set (should see default "baseball" icon)
- NO favorites set (must activate Pick Favorite Teams to confirm)
- User NOT logged in

title: Locally Retained Settings
custom_preconds: Uninstall any MLB.tv app the device, turn system off, reboot system and install current build (full test build, not patch)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings and adjust from default as follows:
 - Show Scores OFF
 - Show Stadium BGs OFF
 - Home Team Preference SET
 - 2 favorites set
3. Return to TODAY view via BACK
4. Quit app
5. Relaunch App & nav to Setting & Observe
custom_expected: Confirm new Settings are retained

title: Show Scores On/Off (Button Functionality)
custom_preconds: App has been launched, Show Scores is set to ON, Home Team set as Home Screen Preference
custom_steps:
(This test is only to be used to test the Settings functionality - additional and more specific tests for Scores On/Off appear in the additional App tests)

1. Activate Settings and confirm Show Scores is set to ON
2. Toggle Show Scores to OFF (uncheck) and note 
3. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
4. Note Today View appearance and confirm expected Scores Off appearance
5. Return to Settings and confirm Show Scores is set to OFF
custom_expected:
- Confirm Scores/Game Data do not appear when set to OFF and return when set to ON and that the enabled states holds as expected.
- Confirm auto-toggle connectivity between Scores and Home Team noted in steps 3 and 7

title: Favorites Tile Order
custom_preconds: Tester has launched app, is either logged in with an account that has no favorites or is logged out, has navigated to Day View & noted order of tiles.
custom_steps:
1. From Today View, open Main Menu and activate Settings
2. In Settings, choose Pick Favorite Teams
3. Choose 3 favorites and note them
4. Activate Back to Settings, Back to Day View & Observe
custom_expected:
Correct Favorites appear tagged in Today View and Grid Order Priority Rules are maintained as follows (Order displays from left to right, top to bottom):

- Live Favorite
- Upcoming Favorite
- Live
- Upcoming
- Final Favorite
- Final

title: Account to App at Login - Favorites Added
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has set and noted favorites in MLB.com profile (login at http://mlb.mlb.com/home  -  then visit https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
custom_steps:
1. In Settings, activate "Log In"
2. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
3. In Settings navigate to and select "Favorite Teams"
custom_expected: Account-set favorite teams are tagged

title: Account to App at Login - Favorites Updated
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has set and noted favorites in MLB.com profile ( https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
custom_steps:
1. In Settings, choose Pick Favorite Teams
2. Choose 2 favorites that are not the same as the account-set favorite teams and note them
3. Back out to Settings and activate Login
4. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
5. Return to Pick Favorite Teams page
custom_expected: Account-set favorite teams are tagged, previous set teams are cleared

title: App to Account at Login - Favorites Added from Local
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has confirmed no favorites have been set in MLB.com profile (start at http://mlb.mlb.com/home and login, then visit https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp )
custom_steps:
1. In Settings, choose Pick Favorite Teams
2. Choose 2 favorites and note them
3. Back out to Settings and activate Login
4. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
5. Return to Pick Favorite Teams page & confirm step 2 favorites remain
6. Check MLB.com profile settings
custom_expected: Newly set teams have been added to users Profile under favorites

title: App to Account and Account to App Connection
custom_preconds:
- Tester has launched app, navigated to Settings, is not logged in and no favorites have been set
- Tester has confirmed no favorites have been set in MLB.com profile https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp
custom_steps:
1. In Settings activate Login
2. Login to profile account and close Activation Message
3. Activate Pick Favorite Teams 
4. Choose >2 teams and note
5. Back out to Settings
6. Via alt computer/device, login to same MLB.com account and check profile https://secure.mlb.com/account/profile.jsp
7. Change teams and note
8. In PS3/4 app Settings page, activate Pick Favorite Teams and observe
custom_expected: Teams added via app appear as expected, adjustments made in account via MLB.com user profile page are relayed to app and appear as expected

title: Favorites Hidden in Team Preference Picker
custom_preconds: User has chosen >1 Favorite Team
custom_steps: In Settings, open Home Team Preference
custom_expected:
Confirm Favorite "Corner" Hints do not appear in select Team grid

Note: Design opted to leave these markers out of this view to avoid confusion.

custom_steps:
Observe the following:

- Live Game Tile Game Status
- Today Game Tiles
- Future Game Tiles
- Past Game tiles
custom_expected: Confirm Game Tiles appear as expected

custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to On in Settings, Calendar has a team set for viewing
custom_steps: Observe the Calendar: current month, a future month and a past month
custom_expected: Confirm days in Calendar appear as expected

custom_steps:
Observe the following:

- Today Game Tiles
- Future Game Tiles
- Past Game tiles
custom_expected:
Confirm Game Tiles appear as expected Teams playing and the following items only should appear:

- Live Game Tiles: In Progress 
- Future Game Tiles: Times and Pitchers (as seen in Scores ON)
- Past Game tiles: Final or other Status as needed

title: Scores OFF - Calendar
custom_preconds: Show Scores is set to Off (unchecked) in Settings
custom_steps: Observe the Calendar: current month, a future month and a past month
custom_expected: Confirm days in Calendar appear with only opposing team and status (time or Final/etc.)

title: Home Team - No Team Set & Back Out

custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings 
3. Select and Activate Home Team under Home Screen Preference
custom_expected: App jumps to Select Team to Display, BACK returns to Settings with Home Screen Preference set to Today

title: Home Team - No Team Set & Choose
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed & no Home Team Preference set
custom_steps:

2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings 
3. Select and Activate Home Team under Home Screen Preference 
- App jumps to Select Team to Display
4. Choose team
custom_expected: App returns to Settings with Home Team Preference set to Team set in step 4

title: Home Team - Persistence
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed & Home Team Preference set and noted
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Home Team
3. In Home Team, select and activate Team Chooser button
- App jumps to Select Team page 
4. Choose different team than current preference
- App jumps to chosen Team page 
5. Back out to Today View
6. Open Main Menu and activate Home Team
custom_expected:
App jumps to Home Team page of users Home Team Preference 
_App does not jump to Team Page from step 4_

title: Home Screen - Swap Types
custom_preconds: MLB.tv installed, Home Team Preference set and Home Screen Preference set to Today (default)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app
2. From Today view, open Main Menu and activate Settings
3. In Home Team Preference select and activate Home Team
4. Activate (CIRCLE) HOME button
- App jumps to Home Team page 
5. Open Main Menu and activate Settings
6. In Home Team Preference select and activate Today
7. Activate (CIRCLE) HOME button
custom_expected: App jumps to Home Team view in step 4 and Today View in step 7

title: Launch Feed - VOD 1st time
custom_steps:

2. Note start button options 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected:
"Beginning" is the only launch option and feed launches program from beginning.
Audio Feeds are not offered.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Resume
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note launch button options 
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning" and "Resume" options are shown with "Resume" enabled. Launch of feed resumes from position in timeline last viewed from.

title: Launch Feed - VOD - Beginning
custom_preconds: User has activated an archived Game Tile that contains a feed that the user has previously viewed for >30 seconds and playback position is known.
custom_steps:
1. Activate previously viewed archived game feed
2. Note RESUME and BEGINNING button options 
3. Set/enable to Beginning
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: Feed launches from beginning.

title: Full Game Playback - VOD
custom_steps:
1. Launch any archive game.
2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected: App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls or buffer issues.

title: Full Game Playback - Live
custom_steps:
1. Launch any live game in Warmup state.
2. Let game play through to completion.
custom_expected:
- App should playback full game from head to tail and exit to same view user launched from without skips/stalls/buffer issues
- Milestones should appear as expected when game is in play

2. Note radio button options
3. Activate any video feed
custom_expected: "Beginning" and "Live" options are shown with "Live" enabled. Feed launches from Live position.

2. Note radio button options
3. Activate any video feed

2. Note radio button options
3. Set Radio Button to RESUME

title: "Stay Tuned" Slate - Live
custom_steps:
1. Launch any live game in Warmup state
2. Once game play is underway (Top 1st), SEEK back to head of timeline and resume
custom_expected: Playback should start from head of broadcast, STAY TUNED slate should not appear for more than 30 seconds

title: Recap
custom_steps:
1. Launch any Recap
2. Let play through to end
3. Launch another recap, test trickplay including SEEK to Jump, SEEK to head, Play/Pause, SEEK FWD to tail & jump
custom_expected:
- Playback is smooth, at conclusion user returned to day grid
- Trickplay functions behave as expected

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Show Scores Set to Off.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should not appear in the timeline.
2. Linescore should not be present.
3. UI Hints should not show EVENTS.
4. Innings and game time should appear as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in game including increased number shown in inning indicator.
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return to Day View.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 2+ innings via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and at play video as expected.

title: Inning Skip FWD to EXIT - Scores Off
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to Off and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD 40 mins and activate [X] to jump.
2. Tap R1 and note inning text advance to next expected inning.
3. Activate [X] to jump.
4. Tap L1 repeatedly until inning text reads TOP 1st.
5. Tap L1 repeatedly (nothing of note should occur).
6. Activate [X] to jump.
7. Tap R1 repeatedly beyond last inning (nothing of note should occur).
8. Activate [X] to jump and let video play out.
custom_expected: App should behave as expected, jump to expected points in game and at play out return to expected Game Day view.

title: Appearance
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched VOD playback with Show Scores Set to On.
custom_steps: Observe UI and full appearance of all elements on screen.
custom_expected:
1. Milestones should appear in the timeline and when selected, appear as expected.
2. Linescore should appear with final result populating all fields as expected.
3. UI Hints should show EVENTS and associated SONY PS button graphics.
4. Innings and total game time should appear as expected.

title: Trickplay FWD Scores On (CONFIRM Expected Result 6 is correct before fail)
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button and observe.
2. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >60 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [R] 4x and let playhead advance until it stops at the tail.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
6. Let app play video out.
custom_expected:
1 - App should show ">>" indicating speed level 1, timer should advance at associated speed.
2 - Each tap of 1-3 should increase ">" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 4th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected advance in timeline and playback should resume as expected.
4-6 - App should jump to near end of stream and at play out, return Day View launched from.

title: Trickplay FWD to RWD Scores On
custom_preconds: User has successfully launched a VOD game stream with Show Scores set to On and playback is behaving as expected. User has skipped FWD 2+ innings via [R1] button.
custom_steps:
1. Seek FWD via D-pad single tap of right button.
2. Tap D-pad [L] 5x and observe.
3. Allow seek to advance >5 mins and activate [X] to jump, then observe.
4. Tap D-pad [L] 4x and let time accumulate until it stops.
5. Activate [X] to jump.
custom_expected:
2 - 1st tap should show indicator changing from ">>" to "<<" indicating speed level 1 RWD, timer should advance back at associated speed. Each tap 2-4 of [L] should increase "<" and timer should advance at associated speeds. 5th tap should be disabled and have no effect.
3 - Jump should reflect expected time jump back in game.
5 - App should jump to head of stream and play video as expected.

title: Audio Feeds - Live Playback
custom_preconds: App is playing back Live game video
custom_steps:
1. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
2. Choose alt audio and let play for 5+ minutes
3. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
4. Choose additional alt audio if available and let play for 5+ minutes, if not skip to step 6.
5. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
6. Choose original Audio feed and let play for 5+ minutes
custom_expected: Confirm audio switches as expected and plays back seamlessly without stalls/skips/failures

title: Audio Feeds - VOD/Archive Playback
custom_preconds: App is playing back VOD game video
custom_steps:
1. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
2. Choose alt audio and let play for 5+ minutes
3. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
4. Choose additional alt audio if available and let play for 5+ minutes, if not skip to step 6.
5. Activate [TRIANGLE] to access audio Menu
6. Choose original Audio feed and let play for 5+ minutes
custom_expected: Confirm audio switches as expected and plays back seamlessly without stalls/skips/failures

title: Captions Live/VOD Appearance
custom_preconds: User is logged in to a Premium Account, Live games are available for playback
custom_steps:
1. Launch a live game and skip (or FFWD) beyond the first inning.
2. Tap [Select] Btn to activate Captions and observe
3. After 2+ minutes of playback, tap [Select] Btn to close captions.
4. Exit video and launch VOD game, repeat steps 1-3.
custom_expected:
Confirm captions appear as expected in both Live and VOD playback.

***Known Issues: 
-Ideally user's MLB.com account profile settings for captions would be respected but currently are not.
-App does not respect user's last activation state, captions reset to off at playback end.

title: Launch Audio Feed - Confirm Appearance
custom_preconds: Feed Select for a live game is open and at least one Audio Feed is available.
custom_steps: Activate any Audio Feed.
custom_expected:
Confirm feed launches as expected, expected audio plays, Game Data/Innings appear current and as expected and background matching game's current venue is shown.

title: Feed Playback
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps: Confirm audio plays through from near beginning to completion.
custom_expected: Audio plays back as expected and jumps out to view launched from upon completion.

title: Pause/Play and Exit
custom_preconds: Audio feed has been successfully launched and is playing back expected audio.
custom_steps:
1. During playback, activate [X] to "pause"
2. Activate [X] to resume.
3. Tap [CIRCLE] to exit.
custom_expected:
Confirm playback stops at pause (does not pause and hold position in stream - this is OK and as expected), resumes from live position at resume and exits Audio Player to page launched from at [CIRCLE] activation.

***Known issue: 
Text reads Pause but functionality is more accurately a STOP. Resume picks up from LIVE. Ticket exploring adjusting the presentation of this feature has been logged.

title: Leaderboard Navigation
custom_preconds: User has navigated to Leaderboards via Stats & Standings PU and tester has noted R1/L1 upcoming page hints
custom_steps:
1. Note R1 adjacent next page hints
2. Tap [R1 ] to nav right
2. Confirm enabled page indicator shifts right
3. Confirm Page title changes to expected
4. Confirm previous page hint appears as expected
5. Repeat steps 1-4 until all pages have been seen
6. Note L1 adjacent previous page hints
7. Tap [L1] to nav left
8. Confirm enabled page indicator shifts to previous
9. Confirm Page title changes to expected
10. Confirm next page hint appears as expected
11. Repeat steps 6-10 until all pages have been seen
12. Activate [SQUARE] to shift to AL and repeat steps 1-11
13. Activate [SQUARE] to shift to NL and repeat steps 1-11
14. Activate [SQUARE] to return to MLB
15. Activate [CIRCLE] Back
custom_expected:
- Confirm all pages are navigable and appear as expected
- [CIRCLE] Back exits to Stats & Standings PU Menu

title: Maintenance Mode
custom_preconds: Tester has access to local config file (lithium_ps3 or lithium_ps4) and ability to package builds or load executable files
custom_steps:
1. In config file, enable "maintenanceMode = true" and "maintenanceModeOnly = true"
2. Load executable to target PS3/4 (or make build and install)
3. Observe PS3/4 non-dismissable Maintenance Mode message
4. In config file, enable "maintenanceMode = true" and "maintenanceModeOnly = false"
5. Load executable to target PS3/4 (or make build and install)
6. Observe PS3/4 dismissable Maintenance Mode message
7. Activate "Close"
custom_expected:
- Tester should observe expected (configurable) message - currently "MLB.TV is currently undergoing maintenance. Please try again later."
- When maintenanceModeOnly = true, user must quit to dismiss.
- When maintenanceModeOnly = false, user can dismiss and application loads

Launch app in the following configuration:

Check Calendar & Day View nav and season limits. Make sure to access Calendar and Today via Main Menu.

title: In-App Network "FAQ" Message Check
custom_preconds: - Special Build required with lithium_ps3 or lithium_ps4 config value set to simulateStall=true (allows cheat PS4 touchpad/PS3 Select Button tapped 5 times will activate messaging)
custom_steps:
1. Play any Video Stream (live or archive)
2. Tap associated button 5 times to activate cheat.
3. Advance through initial Pop Up and through two text pages while observing text.
custom_expected: No typos, formatting errors or misuse of Sony terminology should be seen.

title: PSTV: Launch - Nav - Video Playback
custom_preconds:
- PSTV ON set in Settings > â˜…Debug Settings
- DualshockÂ®4 controller paired with Vita (via Neighborhood - right-click on connected device to start pairing)
custom_steps:
1. Launch app in 480p (Settings > Sound & Display)
2. Confirm app can navigate to all pages
3. Confirm video can be launched 
4. Exit app, set Vita to 780p & relaunch app
5. Confirm app can navigate to all pages
6. Confirm video can be launched 
7. Exit app, set Vita to 1080i & relaunch app
8. Confirm app can navigate to all pages
9. Confirm video can be launched
custom_expected: App launches as expected, all pages can be accessed, video playback appears as expected
